contentrichtext.text: {{otherships|USS Natchez}} {|{{Infobox Ship Begin}} {{Infobox Ship Image |Ship image= [[File:USS Natchez 1827 sloop.jpg|300px]] |Ship caption= }} {{Infobox Ship Career |Hide header= |Ship country= |Ship flag={{USN flag|1840}} |Ship name=USS ''Natchez'' |Ship ordered= |Ship builder=[[Norfolk Naval Shipyard]], [[Portsmouth, Virginia]] |Ship laid down= |Ship launched=1827 |Ship acquired= |Ship commissioned= |Ship decommissioned= |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship renamed= |Ship struck= |Ship reinstated= |Ship honours= |Ship captured= |Ship fate=Scrapped, 1840 |Ship status= |Ship notes= }} {{Infobox Ship Characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship class= |Ship type=[[Sloop-of-war]] |Ship tonnage= |Ship displacement= {{convert|200|LT|t|0|lk=in|abbr=on}} |Ship tons burthen= |Ship length={{convert|127|ft|m|abbr=on}} [[Length between perpendiculars|p/p]] |Ship beam={{convert|33|ft|6|in|m|abbr=on}} |Ship height= |Ship draft={{convert|16|ft|6|in|m|abbr=on}} |Ship depth= |Ship hold depth= |Ship decks= |Ship deck clearance= |Ship propulsion= |Ship sail plan= |Ship speed= |Ship range= |Ship endurance= |Ship boats= |Ship complement=190 officers and enlisted |Ship armament=18 guns |Ship armor= |Ship notes= }} |} '''USS ''Natchez''''' was a [[sloop]]-of-war in the [[United States Navy]] built at the [[Norfolk Naval Shipyard]], [[Portsmouth, Virginia]] in 1827. Commanded by Commander [[George Budd]], she departed [[Hampton Roads]] on 26 July 1827 for the [[Caribbean]]. She patrolled with the [[West Indies Squadron (United States)|West Indies Squadron]] as a deterrent against a resurgence of piracy until forced to sail north by an outbreak of [[yellow fever]] among the crew, returning to New York City on 24 November 1828. The sloop, Commander [[William B. Shubrick]] in command, got underway for the Caribbean on 9 July 1829 and operated in the West Indies and along the Atlantic Coast until she decommissioned at Norfolk, Virginia on 24 August 1831 and was placed in ordinary. Reactivated during the [[Nullification Crisis|South Carolina nullification crisis]], ''Natchez'' was recommissioned on 28 December and sailed for Charleston on 2 January 1833, anchoring in [[Rebellion Roads]] on the 19th. She moved up to [[Charleston Battery]] on 12 March and remained in that important Southern port until tensions were eased when the United States Congress lowered the tariff. She sailed for Hampton Roads on 4 April and, upon arriving Norfolk, was again placed in ordinary. ''Natchez'' returned to the West Indies in 1836 and operated there into 1838. She again cruised in the Caribbean in 1839. She was scrapped at the [[New York Navy Yard]] in 1840. ==References== *{{DANFS|http://www.history.navy.mil/danfs/n2/natchez-i.htm}} ==External links== *[http://www.usna.edu/Library/sca/findingaids/baltimore/index.html Guide to the Journal of the ''Baltimore'', the ''Ruth'', and the USS ''Natchez'', 1826-1828 MS 6] held by [http://www.usna.edu/Library/sca/ Special Collection & Archives], [http://www.usna.edu/Library/ Nimitz Library] at the [http://www.usna.edu United States Naval Academy] {{DEFAULTSORT:Natchez}} [[Category:1827 ships]] [[Category:Ships built in Portsmouth, Virginia]] [[Category:Sloops of the United States Navy]] [[Category:United States Navy Mississippi-related ships]]
